title: spec: `Spec.tree()` merges deptypes when only covering nodes
body:
Resolves #8802.

- previously, output could be confusing when deptypes were only shown for one dependent when a node had *multiple* dependents

- merge the dependency types instead, so all the ways a node is depended on are shown

- also fix default coverage of `Spec.tree()`: it previously defaulted to cover only build and link dependencies, but this is a holdover from when those were the only types.

Example spec:
```
$ spack graph a
o  a
|\
o |  c
| o  b
|/
o  d

$ spack  spec -t --cover edges a
[    ]  a@1.0%clang@8.1.0-apple arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64 
[ lr ]      ^b@1.0%clang@8.1.0-apple arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64 
[b   ]          ^d@1.0%clang@8.1.0-apple arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64 
[ lr ]      ^c@1.0%clang@8.1.0-apple arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64 
[ lr ]          ^d@1.0%clang@8.1.0-apple arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64 
```

Before this (`--cover nodes` is the default):
```
$ spack spec -t --cover nodes a
[    ]  a@1.0%clang@8.1.0-apple arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64 
[ lr ]      ^b@1.0%clang@8.1.0-apple arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64 
[b   ]          ^d@1.0%clang@8.1.0-apple arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64 
[ lr ]      ^c@1.0%clang@8.1.0-apple arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64
```

After this (compare deptypes on d):

```
$ spack spec -t --cover nodes a
[    ]  a@1.0%clang@8.1.0-apple arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64 
[ lr ]      ^b@1.0%clang@8.1.0-apple arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64 
[blr ]          ^d@1.0%clang@8.1.0-apple arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64 
[ lr ]      ^c@1.0%clang@8.1.0-apple arch=darwin-highsierra-x86_64
```
